image.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Fox News host says he wants to see Tulsi Gabbard surfing after RFK Jr's shirtless workout video
item.description: Fox News host Jesse Watters faced backlash after commenting on RFK Jr's shirtless workout video, saying he wanted to see similar content from female Trump picks like Linda McMahon and Tulsi Gabbard. Though Tulsi Gabbard is a surfer, Watters' remarks were criticized on social media, with users calling him a 'pervert'.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kash Patel's blueprint to fix the FBI
item.description: Patel’s plans, which he describes as essential reforms, have drawn sharp criticism from former officials and legal experts who warn of the potential to politicize the FBI and disrupt its mission. Among his proposals are shutting down the FBI’s Washington headquarters, instituting mandatory device scans for federal employees, and investigating political adversaries—actions he argues will restore accountability but which critics say could erode civil liberties and undermine democratic norms.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Canada called 'broken sh**hole' after Trump suggests to Trudeau to make it 51st US state
item.description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau responded with nervous laughter when Donald Trump suggested Canada become the 51st state of the US if a proposed 25% tariff harmed the Canadian economy. Someone at the dinner table at Mar-a-Lago said Canada would be a very liberal state evoking laughter. Trump even suggested that Candana could possibly become two states: a conservative and a liberal one.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Tiffany Fong and why did Elon Musk unfollow her?
item.description: Despite the public interactions and apparent mutual recognition, Musk’s decision to unfollow Fong remains unexplained. In the absence of any public statements from either party, the reasons behind this move are left to speculation. Social media dynamics can often be influenced by a variety of factors, including changes in personal interests, strategic decisions to adjust one’s follower list, or even algorithmic shifts that alter user engagement patterns.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Why is everyone searching for Hannah Kobayashi?
item.description: Hannah Kobayashi, a Maui native, was in the early stages of her career as a photographer. After years of pursuing unpaid projects and honing her craft, she finally secured a paid photography assignment in New York City—a milestone she had been working toward for years. Excited about her trip, Hannah reportedly created a detailed itinerary of places she planned to visit, including restaurants and museums, and booked a hotel room costing thousands of dollars.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Union says nearly 100,000 workers joined Volkswagen strikes across Germany
item.description: Nearly 100,000 Volkswagen workers in Germany protested against plans to cut wages and potentially close plants. IG Metall union warned of more strikes unless the company abandons these cost-cutting measures. Volkswagen faces challenges like weak demand and competition, and has rejected union's proposed savings as unrealistic and delaying the inevitable.

item.title: Kash Patel's list of 60 enemies that he published in his 2022 book 'Government Gangsters'
item.description: Donald Trump's choice for FBI chief, Kash Patel, is a man who maintained a list of enemies, not entirely his personal but those who he thought were part of the Deep State ruling America. The list includes Joe Biden, Kamala Harris and Hillary Clinton but not Barack Obama. FBI director Christopher Wray, and former FBI chief James Comey are also on the list.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Is Dr Parik Patel Kash Patel’s father? News outlet’s gaffe leaves social media in splits
item.description: The gaffe came after a bunch of tweets by the parody handle congratulating his “son” including pointing out that it was “unacceptable” for the senate to vote against his son “Kashu”, and joked that he did a lot of “hard work every day after school in his motel and he ate lots of almonds and drank haldi-doodh (turmeric milk) every day to improve his brain.” He also joked that Vivek Ramaswamy and Kash Patel were childhood friends.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: China bans exports of gallium, germanium, antimony to US
item.description: China has enacted an immediate ban on the export of dual-use items related to gallium, germanium, antimony, and superhard materials to the U.S., in response to Washington's latest crackdown on the Chinese chip sector. The new curbs, citing national security, will require stricter reviews for graphite dual-use exports, escalating trade tensions between the two nations.

item.title: 13 women convicted in Cambodia of acting as surrogates for foreign clients
item.description: Thirteen Filipino women were sentenced to four years in prison for human trafficking-related charges after being found guilty of acting as surrogates in Cambodia. Two years of their sentence were suspended. The women, who are currently in a police hospital, can appeal the verdict. Cambodia banned commercial surrogacy in 2016 due to its growing popularity after restrictions in neighboring countries.

item.title: Iran's president criticises new hijab law
item.description: Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian has expressed doubts about new legislation imposing tougher penalties on women who flout mandatory hijab regulations. The text has not been officially published, but Iranian media reports say the legislation imposes fines equivalent to up to 20 months' average salary for women who improperly wear a hijab or forgo it altogether in public or on social media.

item.title: Donald Trump Jr calls allegations against US President-elect Trump's pick Pete Hegseth 'bullsh*t'
item.description: Donald Trump Jr. has defended Pete Hegseth, President-elect Trump's pick for defence secretary, against allegations reported by The New Yorker of alcohol abuse, sexual misconduct, and mismanagement. Hegseth’s lawyer and former colleagues have dismissed the claims, attributing them to disgruntled former associates. They urge focus on Hegseth's evolving views on national security rather than unproven accusations.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Stand back, I’ll shoot us both': Father holding daughter hostage shot dead by police after standoff
item.description: A man, Charles Ryan Alexander, kidnapped his daughter Oaklynn from her grandmother’s home, prompting an Amber Alert and a police chase. Alexander threatened to kill himself and his daughter during a standoff with police. Authorities eventually shot and killed Alexander, but Oaklynn was unharmed and safely returned to her family.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Meet Richard Tornetta, drummer who took on Elon Musk over a $56 billion pay deal
item.description: A Delaware court invalidated Elon Musk's $56 billion Tesla pay package, deeming the approval process deeply flawed. Shareholder Richard Tornetta's lawsuit prompted the ruling, which mandates Tesla to draft a new plan. Musk plans to appeal, and Tesla may relocate its incorporation to Texas, facing potential challenges.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Florida woman sentenced to life for sealing boyfriend in suitcase to die
item.description: Sarah Boone, 47, received a life sentence for the 2020 suffocation death of her boyfriend, Jorge Torres, in a suitcase. Cellphone videos showed Boone ignoring Torres's pleas for help. Boone claimed they were playing hide-and-seek but was found guilty of second-degree murder after a 10-day trial in Orlando, Florida.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Canadian House of Commons faces potential no-confidence vote amid Parliamentary standstill
item.description: Canadian House of Commons Speaker Greg Fergus schedules opposition days amid Conservative filibuster over unredacted documents. The no-confidence vote against the government may occur as early as next week. Different opposition parties, including the Bloc Québécois and NDP, contemplate their stance on the potential government downfall as the December 10 spending deadline looms.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hezbollah, Israel exchange fire, testing fragile truce
item.description: Hezbollah fired towards Israeli-controlled territory, prompting Israeli airstrikes in Lebanon. Both sides accused each other of breaching the cease-fire. The Israeli military targeted numerous sites in Lebanon, resulting in 10 fatalities. The cease-fire, mediated by the US and France, ended over a year of conflict. Israeli leaders emphasized strong retaliation to maintain deterrence and enforce the peace agreement.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pakistan anti-terrorism court sends Imran on 14-day judicial remand in 7 new cases
Elon Musk and Vivek Ramaswamy reveal DOGE's expiry date. When is it?
item.description: The new Department of Government Efficiency, led by Elon Musk and Vivek Ramaswamy under President-elect Donald Trump, aims to cut wasteful spending and regulations by 2026. Received support includes Bernie Sanders highlighting the Pentagon's budget issues. DOGE plans to disband after achieving its goals.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Aliya Fakhri was trying to get back with ex after split: Jacobs' mother
